definition: circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)

sentences.english: A full moon hung in the sky on Mid-autumn Day.
sentences.chinese: 中秋那天，一轮圆月挂在天空。

sentences.english: I sat in a chair and see the round moon, just like a kind of returning to the poetic.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在椅子上，看那轮圆月，就宛如一种久违的诗意。

sentences.english: However, the Autumn Equinox is not a fixed day and there may or may not be a full moon on that day.
sentences.chinese: 然而，每年秋分的日子都不同，在秋分不一定有圆月。

sentences.english: Full moon on a clear and concrete short life declares.
sentences.chinese: 月圆月缺是具体而微的人生昭示。

sentences.english: Because as a white disk near full moon, there is no trace of clouds.
sentences.chinese: 因为这如白色磁盘圆月旁，没有一丝云彩。

sentences.english: A full moon hangs over the garden.
sentences.chinese: 一轮圆月挂在花园的上空。

sentences.english: For Chinese, the round moon means blessedness and unity.
sentences.chinese: 对于中国人圆月意味着幸福和团圆。

sentences.english: A full moon hung in the sky.
Tonight, who like me quietly in the hope that round moon then?
sentences.chinese: 今夜，谁还在像我这样默默地望那轮圆月呢？

sentences.english: The Mid-Autumn Festival approaching, people first thought is that a full moon.
sentences.chinese: 临近中秋，人们首先想到的是那一轮圆月。

sentences.english: The smooth surface of the lake reflected the bright full moon.
sentences.chinese: 平静的湖面反映出明亮的圆月。

sentences.english: Facing death, be pure like the full moon.
sentences.chinese: 面对死亡，要有如空山圆月的明净。

sentences.english: In the sky the moon shines brightly.
sentences.chinese: 一轮皎白的圆月挂在天上。

sentences.english: When the perfect-circle moon comes out, people will go to the yard while eating moon cakes.
sentences.chinese: 圆月当空之时，人们步入庭院，吃月饼，赏月亮。

sentences.english: The moon is a stone; but it is a brightly numinous stone.
sentences.chinese: 圆月宛若磐石，明亮，庄重而肃穆。

definition: bright moon/refers to 夜明珠, a legendary pearl that can glow in the dark/CL:輪|轮[lun2]
to shine brightly/(fig.) to perceive clearly
